Customer Viewpoint Ratings and Reviews

close Customer Viewpoint Ratings and Reviews

Who leaves ratings and reviews?

Ratings and reviews are provided by customers who have either purchased a vehicle or visited a dealership for service.

How are ratings and reviews collected?

Customers are invited to participate in a survey administered by MaritzCX, an independent, third-party supplier.

Can dealerships edit or remove reviews?

No. Ford personnel and/or dealership personnel cannot modify or remove reviews.

Are reviews modified or monitored before being published?

MaritzCX moderates public reviews to ensure they contain content that meet Review guidelines, such as:

‣No Profanity or inappropriate defamatory remarks

‣Fraud

‣No Personal Identifying information (e.g., customer phone number or email)

‣No Competitor references (e.g., another brand or dealership)

‣Dangerous behavior (e.g. threatening to harm employees or others)

‣Lack of adequate text (e.g., symbols, emoji’s and random letters)

Reviews on the product and not the customer’s Sales or Service experience

                2025 Mustang® EcoBoost® Fastback

                The sleekly designed 2025 Ford Mustang® EcoBoost® fastback is breathtaking at every turn. It features an immersive, customizable 12.4" LCD digital cluster and 13.2" touchscreen, a turbocharged 2.3L EcoBoost® engine and a 10-speed automatic transmission.

                2025 Mustang® EcoBoost® Premium Fastback

                This Mustang® coupe is plush… and powerful. Standard features include the latest SYNC® 4 Technology﻿27  ﻿ displayed on an immersive 13.2" touchscreen. ActiveX®-trimmed heated and cooled front seats and selectable drive modes provide comfort and control. Plus, the available B&O® Sound System by Bang & Olufsen® with 12 speakers, including a subwoofer, provides chest-thumping audio.

                2025 Mustang® EcoBoost® Convertible

                Feel the rush of the open air, with the push of a button. The 2025 Ford Mustang® EcoBoost® convertible takes flight with a heart-pumping engine, selectable drive modes and a sport-tuned independent rear suspension — making every drive exhilarating. And with the customizable, immersive 12.4" LCD digital cluster and 13.2" center touchscreen in the cockpit, you're fully ready for takeoff.

                Take a spin in the Mustang Dark Horse model, equipped with the powerful, naturally aspirated Modified 5.0L Coyote V8 engine.

                Hit the track with the available, easy-to-use, class-first*  drift brake. When activated, the handle applies braking to the rear wheels only, amping up the fun and exhilaration.

                Performance

                Power That Moves You

                Line-lock is intended for closed-track use only. It should never be used on public roads. See Owner’s Manual for information on use.

                Engine Options

                The 2025 Mustang® Dark Horse™ coupe is powered by a naturally aspirated engine that kicks out 500 horsepower68  ,*  and 418 lb.-ft. of torque.68  ,*  That’s 100 hp/L to dominate the road.

                Get behind the wheel of the 2025 Mustang GT coupe. When you feel the power of 486 horsepower68 ,** and 418 lb.-ft. of torque,68 ,* it’s go time.

                This turbocharged engine delivers 315 horsepower68  ,*  and 350 lb.-ft. of torque.68  ,*  It also features Modular Power Cylinder (MPC) engine architecture to help improve performance.

                Transmission Options

                This smooth-shifting transmission is standard on 2025 Mustang EcoBoost trims and available on others. The GT and Dark Horse models also come with the available 10-speed SelectShift® Automatic Transmission featuring steering-wheel mounted paddle shifters. Plus, the industry-first remote rev* lets you push a button on the key fob to make the engine roar.

                Standard on 2025 Mustang GT, the MT82-D4 6-speed manual transmission comes with rev matching for smooth and efficient transitions when shifting into lower gears.

                Only on the 2025 Mustang Dark Horse coupe, this modified TREMEC® TR 3160 6-speed manual transmission*  features an exclusive, titanium-anodized blue knob, rev matching, and no-lift shifting, so you can change gears without taking your foot off the gas.

                Cool Features

                Lock the front brakes while releasing the rear brakes, so you can accelerate, spin, and warm up the rear tires for enhanced grip.*  

                Change modes with your mood or driving conditions. Depending on the Mustang trim, choices include Normal, Sport, Slippery, Drag, Track, or customizable MyMode.

                Help smooth out less-than-ideal road surfaces with the available Gen-3 MagneRide Damping System. Each damper responds 1,000 times per second to help provide confident, road-hugging handling.

                 

                Experience precision handling and a responsive ride. This feature assists in minimizing body roll and road imperfections, while aluminum-alloy rear knuckles and H-arms help reduce unsprung mass.

                Choose the type of steering control you want. Comfort mode is perfect for daily driving with the least amount of steering effort. Sport mode increases steering effort, creating a connection with the road. Normal mode is a balance of comfort and sport — engaging with some steering ease.

                Ford Co-Pilot360® Technology

                These features*   are designed with one thing in mind — helping you feel more in control behind the wheel.

                Optimize your visibility without blinding other drivers. This feature dims your high beams when it senses oncoming traffic.10  

                Detect vehicles in your blind spot with a lighted symbol on your sideview mirror. Resistive steering torque can help mitigate the risk of a collision when changing lanes.10  

                Get an alert if you drift out of your lane. After a few reminders, a coffee cup icon lets you know it’s time to take a break.10  

                Sensors and radar help scan the road, alerting you to potential collisions with vehicles or pedestrians. If an impact is imminent, the brakes will be applied automatically.10 ,*  

                This feature helps slow your vehicle after an incident, potentially lessening injury to passengers and damage to the vehicle, as well as reducing the severity of a potential secondary collision.

                See what’s behind you when you’re backing up. Plus, guidelines help you navigate more easily into parking spaces.10 ,*   

                Backup alerts sound to warn you about the position of objects around your car.

                An infrared sensor near the rearview mirror automatically detects moisture on the windshield and turns on the wipers.

                FAQ

                Find Out More About Mustang

                Which 2025 Ford Mustang model has the most horsepower?

                The 2025 Mustang Dark Horse coupe has the most horsepower. It’s powered by a naturally aspirated Gen-4 5.0L Coyote V8 engine kicking out 500 horsepower68  ,*   and 418 lb.-ft. of torque.68  *  

                 

                What trims are available for 2025 Ford Mustang fastback and convertibles?

                The 2025 Ford Mustang® lineup features several standout trims: EcoBoost® Fastback, EcoBoost® Convertible, EcoBoost® Premium Fastback, EcoBoost® Premium Convertible, GT Fastback, GT Premium Fastback, GT Premium Convertible, Mustang® Dark Horse™, and Mustang® Dark Horse™ Premium.

                What engines are available in the 2025 Ford Mustang lineup?

                Ford Mustang EcoBoost models feature a 2.3L EcoBoost engine, Ford Mustang GT models feature a 5.0L Ti-VCT V8 engine and Ford Mustang Dark Horse models feature a modified, Gen-4 5.0L Ti-VCT V8 engine.

                What is the most fuel-efficient 2025 Ford Mustang model?

                The 2025 Mustang EcoBoost coupe with the standard 2.3L EcoBoost engine and 10-speed automatic transmission has an EPA-estimated rating of 22 city/33 hwy/26 combined mpg.*

                Where can I find the current Ford Mustang® price?

                2025 Ford Mustang prices can be found on the Build & Price page.

                  Your Opt Out Preference Signal is Honored

                  Cookie Preference Center

                  This website uses cookies and other tracking technologies ("Cookies") to enhance user experience, serve targeted ads, and to analyze performance, user activity, and traffic on our website. Some Cookies may collect information that is used in a way that is considered a “Sale,” “Sharing,” or “Targeted Advertising” as those terms are defined under various state laws.

                  To opt out of the collection of information through those Cookies, change the toggle by moving the toggle to the left (so it is grayed out) and click “Confirm My Choices.” If you later change your mind, you can opt back in by sliding the toggle to the right (so it is blue) and click “Confirm My Choices.”

                  Allow Sales and Sharing for Targeted Advertising

                  Your opt-out choice is specific to this website, browser, and device. You will need to set your preference for each browser and device you use to access our website. If you clear the Cookies on your device or browser, you may need to set your preference again. Cookie-enabled opt-out signals may not be effective if you block or clear Cookies.

                  Please note: Opting out may affect our ability to personalize your experience on this website and in connection with your vehicle shopping experience, though we may still use Cookies that do not include Sales, Sharing, or Targeted Advertising. You may still receive non-personalized advertisements on other sites or personalized ads that may be based on information processed before you opted out.

                  This website recognizes the Global Privacy Control (“GPC”), which is designed to recognize certain browser-based opt-out preference signals. To process your opt out request through GPC, you must use a browser or extension supporting the preference signal, and you will need to turn it on for each browser and each device you use.

                  For more information about our privacy practices, you can visit our Privacy Notice. You can also learn about other privacy choices available to you and how to exercise them, such as opting out of non-Cookie based “Sales,” “Sharing,” and “Targeted Advertising” by visiting here.

                  About Opt-Out Preference Signals

                  We have enabled the Global Privacy Control (“GPC”), which is designed to recognize opt-out preference signals. In order to process your request through GPC, you must use a browser or extension supporting the preference signal. If you choose to use this opt-out preference signal, you will need to turn it on for each browser and each device you use.
